meanings.definition: A molecule consisting of two nucleotides joined together.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study dinucleotides to learn about molecules.
meanings.sent2: DNA is made up of dinucleotides that carry genetic information.
meanings.sent3: The dinucleotides in the experiment were so tiny, they looked like little pairs holding hands.
meanings.sent4: In the genetic code, dinucleotides act like a dynamic duo, working together to pass on traits.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the dinucleotides sparkled like tiny gems in a sea of molecules.

meanings.definition: The building blocks of DNA and RNA.
meanings.sent1: Cells use dinucleotides to construct DNA strands.
meanings.sent2: RNA contains dinucleotides that help in protein synthesis.
meanings.sent3: The dinucleotides in the nucleus were busy building the genetic blueprint.
meanings.sent4: Like Lego blocks, dinucleotides snap together to form the genetic code.
meanings.sent5: The dinucleotides lined up in perfect order, like letters spelling out a genetic message.

meanings.sent1: Geneticists study dinucleotides to understand inheritance.
meanings.sent2: Mutations can alter the sequence of dinucleotides in DNA.
meanings.sent3: The dinucleotides in the gene pool were having a party, swapping genetic information.
meanings.sent4: Dinucleotides are like puzzle pieces that fit together to form the genetic puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The dinucleotides danced along the DNA strand, carrying the code of life.
